title: Deciding Weekend Plans
introduction: This lesson explores a dialogue between two friends as they discuss and decide on their plans for the upcoming weekend.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: ¿Tienes algún plan para este fin de semana?
story.translation: Do you have any plans for this weekend?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Aún no he decidido. ¿Tienes alguna idea?
story.translation: I haven't decided yet. Do you have any ideas?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Podríamos ir de excursión a las montañas. Hace tiempo que no nos escapamos a la naturaleza.
story.translation: We could go hiking in the mountains. It’s been a while since we got away to nature.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Me encanta la idea. ¿Sabes de algún buen lugar?
story.translation: I love the idea. Do you know of any good places?

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Hay un parque nacional que no está muy lejos. Tiene varios senderos de diferentes niveles.
story.translation: There’s a national park not too far away. It has several trails of different levels.

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Suena perfecto. Deberíamos preparar un picnic también.
story.translation: Sounds perfect. We should prepare a picnic as well.

story.speaker: speaker1
story.message: Buena idea. Yo puedo llevar sandwiches y agua. ¿Puedes traer algo de fruta y snacks?
story.translation: Good idea. I can bring sandwiches and water. Can you bring some fruit and snacks?

story.speaker: speaker2
story.message: Claro, eso no es problema. Será un fin de semana genial.
story.translation: Sure, that’s no problem. It’s going to be a great weekend.
